intro: Castalia scutifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf castalia, is a herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring compound leaves with a distinctive, broad, shield-like shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, producing white to greenish blooms. Castalia scutifolia thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
